class_notes:
This is a 2-part course. In part 1 students complete online didactic course content asynchronously (available in December). In part 2, students will self-register for one synchronous session taking place at the following dates and times: 
1.	January 19th, 6-8:30pm
2.	January 26th: 6-8:30pm
3.	January 29th: 9:30am-12pm
4.	February 2nd: 6-8:30pm
5.	February 5th: 9:30am-12pm
course_description: This course will introduce public health students to concepts of leadership including various leadership styles; emotional intelligence; collaboration; principles of project management including budgets, human resources, conflict, negotiation and mediation. Lastly, the course will introduce key aspects of audience-appropriate communication and will discuss communication frameworks specific to public health communication.
sections: Class Nbr: 3870, Section #: 1, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: Meets Online, Instructor: S. Blake, Status: Open
